001/*

006
007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a wireframe model of an arc from a circle in
015   the xy-plane centered at the origin.
016
017   @see Circle
018   @see DiskSector
019   @see RingSector
020   @see ConeSector
021   @see CylinderSector
022   @see SphereSector
023   @see TorusSector
024*/
025public class CircleSector extends Model implements MeshMaker
026{
027   public final double r;
028   public final double theta1;
029   public final double theta2;
030   public final int n;
031
032   /**
033      Create half of a circle in the xy-plane with radius 1 and
034      with 8 line segments around the circumference.
035   */
036   public CircleSector( )
037   {
038      this(1, 0, Math.PI, 8);
039   }
040
041
042   /**
043      Create half of a circle in the xy-plane with radius {@code r}
044      and with 8 line segments around the circumference.
045
046      @param r  radius of the circle
047   */
048   public CircleSector(final double r)
049   {
050      this(r, 0, Math.PI, 8);
051   }
052
053
054   /**
055      Create an arc (a sector) of a circle in the xy-plane with
056      radius {@code r}, starting angle {@code theta1}, ending
057      angle {@code theta2}, and with {@code n} line segments
058      around the circumference.
059   <p>
060      The arc is drawn counterclockwise starting at angle
061      {@code theta1} and ending at angle {@code theta2}. Notice
062      that this means that if {@code theta1 <= theta2}, then we are
063      drawing the arc between the angles, but if {@code theta1 > theta2},
064      then we are removing the arc between the angles.
065   <p>
066      Notice that any two angles define two arcs from a circle.
067      We want a definition for this method that unambiguously
068      determines, for any two angles, which of the two arcs to
069      draw.
070
071      @param r       radius of the circle
072      @param theta1  beginning angle of the sector (in radians)
073      @param theta2  ending angle of the sector (in radians)
074      @param n       number of line segments in the circle's circumference
075      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 3
076   */
077   public CircleSector(final double r,
078                       double theta1, double theta2,
079                       final int n)
080   {
081      super(String.format("CircleSector(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d)",
082                                        r, theta1, theta2, n));
083
084      if (n < 4)
085         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 3");
086
087      theta1 = theta1 % (2*Math.PI);
088      theta2 = theta2 % (2*Math.PI);
089      if (theta1 < 0) theta1 = 2*Math.PI + theta1;
090      if (theta2 < 0) theta2 = 2*Math.PI + theta2;
091      if (theta2 <= theta1) theta2 = theta2 + 2*Math.PI;
092
093      this.r = r;
094      this.theta1 = theta1;
095      this.theta2 = theta2;
096      this.n = n;
097
098      // Create the arc's geometry.
099      final double deltaTheta = (theta2 - theta1) / (n - 1);
100
101      // Create all the vertices.
102      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
103      {
104         final double c = Math.cos(theta1 + i * deltaTheta),
105                      s = Math.sin(theta1 + i * deltaTheta);
106         addVertex( new Vertex(r * c, r * s, 0) );
107      }
108
109      // Create the line segments around the arc.
110      final LineStrip lineStrip = new LineStrip();
111      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
112      {
113         lineStrip.addIndex(i);
114      }
115      addPrimitive(lineStrip);
116   }
117
118
119
120   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
121   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
122
123   @Override public int getVertCount() {return n;}
124
125   @Override
126   public CircleSector remake(final int n, final int k)
127   {
128      final int newN;
129      if (n != this.n)
130         newN = n;
131      else
132         newN = k;;
133
134      return new CircleSector(this.r,
135                              this.theta1, this.theta2,
136                              newN);
137   }
138}//CircleSector
